history.initialFormation: Established from states formed in the Allied zones of occupation by the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.
history.coldWarEra: Part of the Western Bloc during the Cold War.

economicMiracle.description: Rapid industrial growth and economic development during the 1950s, leading to becoming the world's second-largest economy.
economicMiracle.economicPolicies: Full alignment with NATO, membership in the European Union precursor agreements.

positionTowardsEastGermany.initialClaim: Exclusive mandate for all of Germany, representing the sole democratically reorganised continuation of the 1871–1945 German Reich.
positionTowardsEastGermany.relationsImprovement: Basic Treaty in 1972, leading to improved relations and eventual reunification.

geographicalDistributionOfGovernment.provisionalCapitalDetails: Initially, Bonn was the provisional seat of government institutions.
geographicalDistributionOfGovernment.statesMerged: Three southwestern states merged to form Baden-Württemberg in 1952.
geographicalDistributionOfGovernment.saarlandJoining: Saarland joined West Germany as a state in 1957.
